events.name: talk.js
events.description: The final talk.js of this year will be on Tuesday 15 December. This time we will have all lightning talks of 5~10 minutes and instead use more time for discussions. Leave a comment of message us if you like to share anything! Scheduled Talks: • Stats for SG JS Dev community: data.webuild.sg - Sayanee Basu • Struggle of Building Email Editor from Scratch - Tan Shiaw Uen • Running ES2015 code with Node v5 and Babel 6 - Soares Chen • Phasing out legacy - Claudio Mettler • SVG Filters - Yongjun • JavaScript Inheritance - Min • Aspect Oriented Programming - Shawn Lim • Web Speech - Sebastian Deckers • Call stack, heap, queue, event loop - Jesstern Rays Location: PayPal SingaporeSuntec Tower 55 Temasek Boulevard #09-01Singapore Venue, free drinks and pizza sponsored by PayPal. Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions See you there!
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Suntec Tower 5, 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01

events.name: Learn Web Attacks using OWASP WebGoat, A Demo
events.description: A lot of us talk about various security attacks on the web, but do we actually know how they are done in real time and where's the problem in coding? This demo will showcase how attackers are misusing the web application to bypass security controls.Following attacks will be covered in the demo:1. Path Traversal attack2. Bypassing functional access control3. Bypassing data access control4. AJAX security loopholes (DOM injection, XML Injection, JSON injection, Silent transaction attacks)5. Cross Site Scripting (Reflected, Stored and DOM based)6. SQL Injection (numeric and string based)7. Malicious file uploads and impact on back-end servers This is purely a demo and doesn't involve any PPT. So, this is only for technical people. Demonstrator: Viswanath S Chirravuri Viswanath S Chirravuri has over 10 years of experience in Software Security. Currently he is a senior Security Architect at a leading digital security company, GEMALTO. He actively holds industry certifications like CISSP, CEH, GWAPT, Security+, PMP and SCJP. Viswanath is accredited by CA Technologies on Identity and Access management suite of products. Over the past few years, he has been giving training's on various SAST and DAST tools to application security engineers across different industries.
events.location: Akamai Singapore office, 1 Raffles Place, #16-61, One Raffles Place Tower 2, Singapore 048616

events.name: First MeetUp!
events.description: We are gonna have a chat! The date is Tuesday, 15 December. The place is "Settler's Cafe".  http://www.hungrygowhere.com/singapore/settlers_cafe_central/ Participation fee - Guest has to order from the menu at least a drink for per guest.
